data.title: Feeding dogs
data.statement:
You must feed your [[d]] dogs, for that you have [[k]] grams of kibble. Each weight of dog corresponds to a dose of kibble : 
weight ≤ 5kg corresponds to 80g
5kg < weight ≤ 10kg corresponds to 150g
10kg < weight ≤ 20kg corresponds to 260g
20kg < weight ≤ 30kg corresponds to 375g
30kg < weight ≤ 40kg corresponds to 470g
40kg < weight ≤ 50kg corresponds to 560g
50kg < weight corresponds to 600g

Will your reserves be enough to feed all your dogs ?
data.stubGenerator:
read k:int
read d:int
loop d read weight:float
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> [[k]] : an integer (in g)
<<Line 2 :>> [[d]] : an integer
<<Next [[d]] lines :>> a floating number representing the weight of a dog (in kg)
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> {{Yes}} if you can feed your dogs, otherwise the missing mass of kibbles [[m]] (an integer, in grams).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must feed your d dogs, for that you have k grams of kibble. Each weight of dog corresponds to a dose of kibble :
weight ≤ 5kg corresponds to 80g
5kg < weight ≤ 10kg corresponds to 150g
10kg < weight ≤ 20kg corresponds to 260g
20kg < weight ≤ 30kg corresponds to 375g
30kg < weight ≤ 40kg corresponds to 470g
40kg < weight ≤ 50kg corresponds to 560g
50kg < weight corresponds to 600g

Will your reserves be enough to feed all your dogs ?
Input
Line 1 : k : an integer (in g)
Line 2 : d : an integer
Next d lines : a floating number representing the weight of a dog (in kg)
Output
Line 1 : Yes if you can feed your dogs, otherwise the missing mass of kibbles m (an integer, in grams).
Constraints
0 ≤ k
1 ≤ d
Example
Input
460
3
4.2
6.3
10.5
Output
30
